data.title: Thomas Hellman
data.meta_description: is a French Canadian singer born in 1975 to a Texan father and French mother. After the success of his first album Stories from Oscar’s Old Café , he gained national acclaim with his French album L’Appartement on Justin Time Records, produced by…
data.text:
Thomas Hellman is a French Canadian singer born in 1975 to a Texan father and French mother. After the success of his first album "Stories from Oscar’s Old Café", he gained national acclaim with his French album "L’Appartement" on Justin Time Records, produced by noted Quebec producer Jean Massicotte.Fact|date=May 2007 He is now working on his third album and sharing his time between France and Quebec.

In 2005, he performed at the Festival Voix d'Amériques in Montreal that was recorded by CBC Radio One, [cite web | url = http://www.fva.ca/2005.e/horaire/20050216/ | title = Wednesday, February 16, 2005 | work = Festival Voix d'Amériques | accessdate = 2007-02-06 ] and Fête de la Musique in Toronto. [cite web | url = http://www.alliance-francaise.ca/en/Documents/fete_programme_screen.pdf | title = fete programme | accessdate = 2007-02-06 ]
